results.title: Forest fire control
results.brief_description: The south-west of Western Australia is the main forest area of the state and extensive fire control methods are established there. Look-out towers, often built on a tall Karri tree, are connected by telephone with Central Control. During the summer these are manned 24 hours a day. When a fire is sighted, its exact locality is plotted and Central Control immediately despatches fire-fighting equipment to the spot. Water from a storage tank and from individual spray packs is most effective in the early stages. As soon as some control has been reached special rakes are used to rake back the ashes and undergrowth. The area is patrolled until it is declared safe. The film makes the point that it is harder to extinguish fires then to prevent them.

results.title: The Forerunner
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Professor C.H. Munro introduces Australia’s water problem - the periodic cycles of flood and drought and the first major step in its solution, the Snowy Mountains scheme. The first part shows floods in town and country areas and rescue teams at work; the second, drought and a family forced to abandon their property; finally, the aims of the Snowy Mountains Scheme and some of the work in progress. Little commentary is used. Ballads and natural sound accompany evocative visuals.

results.title: The Force of gravity
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff, McGraw-Hill Films and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Our attempt to understand gravitation, especially in its relation to cosmology and geophysics; the views of the Egyptians and the greeks, the later work of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo and Newton and modern methods of studying and measuring gravity in different parts of the earth’s surface, with an explanation of the effect of the moon’s gravitational pull on the earth.

results.title: Forage harvesting
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film presents a demonstration of labor-saving machines and methods for harvesting forage crops. Greater accent on mixed farming in Canada has increased the need for winter silage and, in the busy harvest season, for more efficient ways of cutting, handling and storing forage crops. We are shown the use of such equipment as the forage harvester and the automatic unloader, which greatly reduces the amount of work and time involved.

results.title: For Your Tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Robert Wylam, Graham Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Made to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of World War 1, this film traces events leading to the declaration of war, and eventually to Canada’s involvement, when, on August 3, 1914, Great Britain and the Empire declared their support of their allies. This film uses both archival and new footage which reveals the contributions and sacrifices of those Canadians who served in World War 1.

results.title: For you, Mr. Bell
results.creator_credit: William Canning, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film profile of Alexander Graham Bell, inventor of the telephone and pioneer in many other fields of technology, including heavier-than-air flight, is a warmly human story. Full of anecdotes, it tells the story of a man whose main concern was finding a way to alleviate the problems of the deaf. It is told largely through photographs of Bell, of his wife who was deaf, of their spacious retreat at Baddeck, Nova Scotia, and of people who shared in his work and experiments. Written by Strowan Robertson, photography by David de Volpi.

results.title: For science and the arts
results.brief_description: A rare distinction for outstanding achievements in science or art is selection to the exclusive German Order “Pour le Merite”, limited to 30 German and 30 foreign artists and scientists. Shows distinguished members and outstanding scientific and artistic achievements of the 19th and 20th centuries. In English and German language.

results.title: For love or money
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Deals with the satisfaction one feels when working for yourself, doing something you really enjoy, even if the money is not as much as working for an employer. A commercial artist, sign-writer and a mechanic present their viewpoints.
